case_data.chief_complaint: Difficulty reading small print at near for the past year.
case_data.ocular_history: No prior ocular disease or surgery.

questions.q: Which is the most likely diagnosis?
questions.explanation: Gradual onset near blur in early 30s may indicate early presbyopic shift.

questions.q: What is the most appropriate management?
questions.explanation: Near add restores comfortable near vision for presbyopia.

questions.q: Which test best differentiates presbyopia from accommodative insufficiency?
questions.explanation: Measuring accommodation amplitude distinguishes age-related from functional loss.

questions.q: Why might early presbyopia present sooner in hyperopes?
options: Greater accommodative demand at all distances
questions.answer: Greater accommodative demand at all distances
questions.explanation: Hyperopes must accommodate more, revealing presbyopia earlier.

case_data.chief_complaint: No visual symptoms; referred for high IOP on screening.

clinical_data.optic_nerve: C/D ratio OD 0.7, OS 0.6 with inferior rim thinning OD
clinical_data.visual_fields: OD: superior arcuate defect; OS: normal

imaging.oct: RNFL thinning in inferior quadrant OD

questions.q: What is the most likely diagnosis?
questions.explanation: Elevated IOP, optic nerve changes, and corresponding VF defect indicate POAG.

questions.q: Which is the strongest risk factor for progression?
questions.explanation: Thin CCT is a strong independent risk factor for glaucoma progression.

questions.q: First-line treatment for this patient?
questions.explanation: Prostaglandins are first-line for lowering IOP in POAG.

questions.q: Which structural change in the ONH is typical of glaucoma?
questions.explanation: Glaucoma causes progressive cupping with relatively preserved rim color until late.

case_data.chief_complaint: Discomfort and dryness with soft contact lenses by midday.
case_data.ocular_history: Daily wear silicone hydrogel lenses for 3 years.

clinical_data.slit_lamp_exam: Mild bulbar hyperemia, grade 2 papillae upper tarsus OU

questions.q: Most likely diagnosis?
questions.explanation: Contact lens wear with papillae and discomfort suggests GPC.

questions.q: Which management step is most appropriate initially?
questions.explanation: Switching to daily disposables reduces allergen and deposit load.

questions.q: Which finding is characteristic of GPC?
questions.explanation: Mechanical/allergic response on superior tarsal conjunctiva produces papillae.

questions.q: What adjunct therapy could help symptoms?
questions.explanation: Controls allergic inflammation contributing to GPC.

case_data.chief_complaint: Painless loss of vision OS over 2 days.

clinical_data.fundus_exam: OS: pale retina with cherry-red spot at fovea

questions.q: Most likely diagnosis?
questions.explanation: Sudden profound vision loss with pale retina and cherry-red spot indicates CRAO.

questions.q: Which systemic condition is most strongly associated?
questions.explanation: Emboli from carotid plaques are a major cause of CRAO.

questions.q: Urgent management should include:
questions.explanation: Part of immediate measures to attempt IOP reduction and restore flow.

questions.q: Which investigation is most important to order urgently?
questions.explanation: Identifies carotid stenosis or plaque as embolic source.

clinical_data.given: A +5.00 D thin lens is moved 5 cm closer to the eye from its original position. Calculate the change in effective power.

questions.q: What is the new effective power when a +5.00 D thin lens is moved 5 cm closer to the eye?
questions.explanation: Using vertex formula: F' = F / (1 - dF), with d = -0.05 m (closer to eye) gives ~+4.87 D.

questions.q: Moving a positive lens closer to the eye will:
questions.explanation: For plus lenses, moving closer reduces effective power at the eye.

questions.q: The Abbe value of a lens material primarily affects:
questions.explanation: Lower Abbe numbers produce more chromatic aberration.

questions.q: Which lens form minimizes oblique astigmatism?
questions.explanation: Properly chosen meniscus form reduces off-axis aberrations.
